panels.description: The ‘Server Active’ metric is an indicator to quickly check the status of a server or service. Yellow occurs when any of our service nodes such as ES Cluster/Kafka/Connect/Logstash/Kibana or spark master node goes down. Also when task has not the state of "RUNNING" or the “task” details are missing from the listener, this metric shows “Yellow” status. Also   If the free disk space percentage on one of the ES or Kafka nodes under /apps folder is less than or equal to 15%, it is displayed in yellow.  If everything is down, the status will be red.
panels.title: [Dev] Server Active

panels.description: Check whether the ‘ES_PIPELINE_UPLOAD_TEST_WM’ is being processed within the last 30 minutes. If it does not work within 30 minutes or doesn't exist it in es_processed_pipeline table, you need to check our middleware, etc. For this reason, the status will be displayed in red. Otherwise it displays in green.
panels.title: [Dev] ES Pipeline

panels.description: Maximum disk usage among ES/Kafka all nodes : Left side is the maximum size of es node, Right side is the maximum size of kafka node
panels.title: [Dev] Max. Disk Used

Also   If the free disk space percentage on one of the ES or Kafka nodes under /apps folder is less than or equal to 15%, it is displayed in yellow.  If everything is down, the status will be red.
panels.title: [Prod5] Server Active

panels.description: Check whether the ‘ES_PIPELINE_UPLOAD_TEST_WM’ is being processed within the last 30 minutes. If it does not work within 30 minutes or doesn't exist it in es_processed_pipeline table, you need to check our middleware, etc. For this reason, the status will be displayed in red. Otherwise it displays in green.
panels.title: [Prod5] ES Pipeline

panels.description: Number of nodes in the cluster
panels.title: ES Nodes

panels.description: The first node to boot in a Kafka cluster automatically becomes the controller, and there can be only one. The controller in a Kafka cluster is responsible for maintaining the list of partition leaders, and coordinating leadership transitions (in the event a partition leader becomes unavailable). If it becomes necessary to replace the controller, a new controller is randomly chosen by ZooKeeper from the pool of brokers. In general, it is not possible for this value to be greater than one, but you should definitely alert on a value of zero that lasts for more than a short period (< 1s) of time.
panels.title: Kafka Health

panels.description: The first node to boot in a Kafka cluster automatically becomes the controller, and there can be only one. The controller in a Kafka cluster is responsible for maintaining the list of partition leaders, and coordinating leadership transitions (in the event a partition leader becomes unavailable). If it becomes necessary to replace the controller, a new controller is randomly chosen by ZooKeeper from the pool of brokers. In general, it is not possible for this value to be greater than one, but you should definitely alert on a value of zero that lasts for more than a short period (< 1s) of time.
panels.title: Kafka Health
